turns.user_message: And hey, i remember you mentioning a specific iso limit for your lumina x-pro when you're doing astrophotography to keep the noise down. what was that exact maximum iso you found acceptable?
turns.expected_response: You mentioned that for your Lumina X-Pro, the absolute highest ISO you can use for astrophotography without getting unacceptable noise for your prints is 6400. (Memory: 'After a lot of trial and error, I figured out that for my Lumina X-Pro, the absolute highest ISO I can use for astrophotography without getting unacceptable noise for my prints is 6400. Anything above that just ruins the image quality.')

relevant_memories.content: I've been really getting into astrophotography lately with my new Lumina X-Pro camera. It's a steep learning curve, but super rewarding.
One of the biggest challenges with astrophotography is managing noise at high ISOs. I've been testing different settings on my Lumina X-Pro to find the sweet spot.

After a lot of trial and error, I figured out that for my Lumina X-Pro, the absolute highest ISO I can use for astrophotography without getting unacceptable noise for my prints is 6400. Anything above that just ruins the image quality.
